means: <非正>逃避工作的人，偷懒的人

sentence.Network_en: He's not a slacker, he's the best worker they've got.
sentence.Network_cn: 他可不是个会偷懒的人，他是他们最好的工人。

sentence.Network_en: He's a slacker, he actually skipped off and left us to do the clearing away.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个懒鬼, 他居然悄悄地溜走而把清除工作留给我们来做.

sentence.Network_en: Bill was kicked out of the military for being a slacker.
sentence.Network_cn: 比尔因懒惰懈怠而从军队里被赶了出来.

entry.def: If you describe someone as a slacker, you mean that they are lazy and do less work than they should.

example.ex: He's not a slacker, he's the best worker they've got.
example.tran: 他可不是个会偷懒的人，他是他们最好的工人。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who shirks their work or duty (especially one who tries to evade military service in wartime)

auth_sentence.content: There was even a patch of ice in the slacker shallows.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was even a patch of ice in the slacker shallows.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was even a patch of ice in the slacker shallows.

auth_sentence.content: But my impression is that most podcast hosts run on slacker time.
auth_sentence.res_content: But my impression is that most podcast hosts run on slacker time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But my impression is that most podcast hosts run on slacker time.
